dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Amazon's Jeff Bezos just gave away $98 million to 24 different nonprofits across the country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Amazon's Jeff Bezos just gave away ninety eight dollars million to twenty four different nonprofits across the country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Tuesday, the Amazon founder ands CEO outlined his plans to give $97.5 million to two dozen nonprofits around the country that are providing services to the homeless.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's part of his Day One Fund, right? He announced that back in September, pledging a total of $2 billion for homeless families and preschools.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's part of his Day One Fund, right? He announced that back in September, pledging a total of two dollars billion for homeless families and preschools.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is the first round of giving that Bezos will conduct as part of his Day One Fund, announced in September, in which he pledged $2 billion to help homeless families and create Montessori-inspired preschools.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And, um, he actually attended a Montessori school himself, so that inspiration makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And, um, he actually attended a Montessori school himself, so that inspiration makes sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is the first round of giving that Bezos will conduct as part of his Day One Fund, announced in September, in which he pledged $2 billion to help homeless families and create Montessori-inspired preschools. (Bezos himself attended a Montessori school.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The grants are pretty substantial too—each organization is getting either $2.7 million or $4.8 million. That's a huge boost for these groups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The grants are pretty substantial too-each organization is getting either two point seven dollars million or four point eight dollars million. That's a huge boost for these groups.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Each organization will receive $2.5 million or $5 million from the Day 1 Families Fund.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: One of the recipients is the Urban Resource Institute in New York. They're getting $5 million to focus on job training for homeless families, especially in high-demand fields like coding.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: One of the recipients is the Urban Resource Institute in New York. They're getting five dollars million to focus on job training for homeless families, especially in high-demand fields like coding.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One recipient is the Urban Resource Institute in New York, which plans to use its $5 million grant to bolster the job training and placement it can provide to homeless families, with a focus on jobs that pay more than minimum wage or are increasingly in demand, in areas like coding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, interesting—and they operate shelters in Long Island City, which, you know, is where Amazon just announced one of its new headquarters locations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, interesting-and they operate shelters in Long Island City, which, you know, is where Amazon just announced one of its new headquarters locations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The non-profit operates 12 domestic violence shelters and six homeless shelters in New York City, including one for homeless families in Long Island City. Amazon announced last week that Long Island City would be the site of one of its additional headquarters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Nathaniel Fields, their CEO, said they're in celebratory mode. They only applied a few weeks ago and expect the funds by November.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Nathaniel Fields, their C E O, said they're in celebratory mode. They only applied a few weeks ago and expect the funds by November.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We're in celebratory mode. This is a significant grant, says Nathaniel Fields, president and CEO of Urban Resource Institute, who said they submitted a grant application just a few weeks ago and expect to receive the funds by the end of November.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's not just New York though—places like Northern Virginia Family Service are also on the list. Amazon's building another HQ nearby in Crystal City.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's not just New York though-places like Northern Virginia Family Service are also on the list. Amazon's building another H Q nearby in Crystal City.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another recipient is Northern Virginia Family Service, based in Oakton, Virginia, which will receive $2.5 million. Amazon is building its second new headquarters in nearby Crystal City, Virginia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And this is actually Bezos's largest disclosed donation so far—$98 million. His previous biggest was $33 million for DACA scholarships.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this is actually Bezos's largest disclosed donation so far-ninety eight dollars million. His previous biggest was thirty three dollars million for D A C A scholarships.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The $100 million in donations amounts to the largest disclosed sum of money that Bezos has given away yet. The biggest gift was previously the $33 million he donated to fund college scholarships for 1,000 undocumented immigrant high school students who live in the U.S. with Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals, or DACA, status.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is still massive, but, like, when you're worth over $100 billion, it puts things in perspective.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is still massive, but, like, when you're worth over one hundred dollars billion, it puts things in perspective.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He is currently worth $125 billion, according to Forbes real-time rankings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, though his net worth did drop recently—I think around $35 billion since October? Still comfortably the world's richest.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, though his net worth did drop recently-I think around thirty five dollars billion since October? Still comfortably the world's richest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, due to a decline in the price of Amazon shares thats a $35 billion drop since we published The Forbes 400 list in early October.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He mentioned working with experts from nonprofits and government to choose these organizations. I wonder how they narrowed it down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He mentioned working with experts from nonprofits and government to choose these organizations. I wonder how they narrowed it down.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a statement, Bezos said he worked with a dozen experts across the nonprofit and government sectors to decide which organizations to fund.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Must've been a tough but rewarding process. And he hasn't even detailed plans yet for the preschool part of the fund.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Must've been a tough but rewarding process. And he hasn't even detailed plans yet for the preschool part of the fund.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has yet to come out with concrete plans for the Day 1 Academies Fund, for which he will create a network of Montessori-inspired preschools in low-income areas.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the Montessori-inspired schools for low-income areas—that could be a game changer too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the Montessori-inspired schools for low-income areas-that could be a game changer too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has yet to come out with concrete plans for the Day 1 Academies Fund, for which he will create a network of Montessori-inspired preschools in low-income areas.

dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It'll be interesting to see how this all unfolds.
